intro: Rubus hirtus var. rudericola, commonly known as the rough bramble, is a variant of the bramble genus Rubus. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as drupes, which are typically red or black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a resilient and adaptable species within the Rubus family.
